verses.verse: A Prayer <WH8605> of David. <WH1732> Hear <WH8085> the right, <WH6664> O LORD, <WH3068> attend <WH7181> to my cry, <WH7440> give ear <WH238> to my prayer, <WH8605> that goes not out of feigned <WH4820> lips. <WH8193>
Let my sentence <WH4941> come <WH3318> forth <WH3318> from your presence; <WH6440> let your eyes <WH5869> behold <WH2372> the things that are equal. <WH4339>

You have proved <WH974> my heart; <WH3820> you have visited <WH6485> me in the night; <WH3915> you have tried <WH6884> me, and shall find <WH4672> nothing; <WH1077> I am purposed <WH2161> that my mouth <WH6310> shall not transgress. <WH5674>
Concerning the works <WH6468> of men, <WH120> by the word <WH1697> of your lips <WH8193> I have kept <WH8104> me from the paths <WH734> of the destroyer. <WH6530>
Hold <WH8551> up my goings <WH838> in your paths, <WH4570> that my footsteps <WH6471> slip <WH4131> not.
I have called <WH7121> on you, for you will hear <WH6030> me, O God: <WH410> incline <WH5186> your ear <WH241> to me, and hear <WH8085> my speech. <WH565>

Show your marvelous <WH6395> loving kindness, <WH2617> O you that save <WH3467> by your right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> them which put their trust <WH2620> in you from those that rise <WH6965> up against them.
Keep <WH8104> me as the apple <WH380> <WH1323> of the eye, <WH5869> hide <WH5641> me under the shadow <WH6738> of your wings, <WH3671>
From the wicked <WH7563> that oppress <WH7703> me, from my deadly <WH5315> enemies, <WH341> who compass <WH5362> me about.
They are enclosed <WH5462> in their own fat: <WH2459> with their mouth <WH6310> they speak <WH1696> proudly. <WH1348>
They have now <WH6258> compassed <WH5437> us in our steps: <WH838> they have set <WH7896> their eyes <WH5869> bowing <WH5186> down <WH5186> to the earth; <WH776>
Like <WH1825> as a lion <WH738> that is greedy <WH3700> of his prey, <WH2963> and as it were a young <WH3715> lion <WH3715> lurking <WH3427> in secret <WH4565> places.
Arise, <WH6965> O LORD, <WH3068> disappoint <WH6923> him, cast <WH3766> him down: <WH3766> deliver <WH6403> my soul <WH5315> from the wicked, <WH7563> which is your sword: <WH2719>

From men <WH4962> which are your hand, <WH3027> O LORD, <WH3068> from men <WH4962> of the world, <WH2465> which have their portion <WH2506> in this life, <WH2416> and whose belly <WH990> you fill <WH4390> with your hid <WH6845> treasure: they are full <WH7646> of children, <WH1121> and leave <WH5117> the rest <WH3499> of their substance to their babes. <WH5768>
As for me, I will behold <WH2372> your face <WH6440> in righteousness: <WH6664> I shall be satisfied, <WH7646> when I awake, <WH6974> with your likeness. <WH8544>
